remarks: The group sum in a substructure is the same as the group sum in the original structure.  The only requirement on the substructure is that it contain the identity element; neither ` G ` nor ` H ` need be groups. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Dec-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)
statement:
gsumress.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsumress.o $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
gsumress.h $e |- H = ( G |`s S ) $.
gsumress.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. V ) $.
gsumress.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. X ) $.
gsumress.s $e |- ( ph -> S C_ B ) $.
gsumress.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> S ) $.
gsumress.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. e. S ) $.
gsumress.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( ( .0. .+ x ) = x /\ ( x .+ .0. ) = x ) ) $.
gsumress $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) = ( H gsum F ) ) $.
$d .+ x $.
$d .0. x $.
$d B x $.
$d G x $.
$d H x $.
$d S x $.
$d ph x $.
